column5:
It's Time To Kick Some Closed Minded Asses Off My Page! ~ Michael Baisden

For years I have posted topics ranging from political news and social injustices to relationships and sex. These topics reflect my range of interest. Like many of you I'm open to difference belief systems, different cultures, travel, and learning from different points of view.

But lately I've noticed that too many of my Facebook family feels the need to interject race and religion into every topic while others go out of their way to express how much they don't like a particular topic. Instead of offering a better argument they insult and bully people because they lack the information or aptitude to engage in a civil debate. To those people I say this, "Your presence is not welcome on Michael Baisden Live and it's time to clean house...again!

The only way we're going to grow and continue to promote intelligent dialogue is to block those whose only interest is to be contrary to every subject and to insult others because they don't see the world the same way. And worse of all they attack those of a different race or religious belief, or non belief. 
It may be a free country but membership on this page has a cost and that's respect. I will not allow those negative people to use my platform to promote hate and ignorance. 

Whites, Hispanics, Asians are all apart of my FB family as well as my cool black family who enjoy a good debate. And by the way, so are gays, the transgender community and Swingers. This is an adult page for free thinkers not for people stuck in a box. 

So, I'm serving notice that whoever attacks another person based on race, religion, lifestyle, or sexual orientation will be blocked. I have exciting plans for this page and now that we're rolling again it's time to kick some of these closed minded asses off the page so the rest of us can get down with some real conversation, live podcast, and meet and greets. 

Let's get this party started! ~ Michael Baisden

P.S. Excuse the typos, I was busy blocking people while I was writing. lol

So, It comes as no surprise that Newsweek would produce an article of arrogant swill such as this. ??Star Wars??Class Wars: Is Mars the Escape Hatch for the 1 Percent???By Kevin Maney.  Maney states for all of our simple little shrunken minds that ?œWhile many dream of escaping earth to settle on Mars, billionaires like Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos are working to make it possible. But finding a new home on the red planet will likely only be for the rich, leaving the poor to suffer as earth's environment collapses and conflict breaks out.??

With those idiots gone, and our Constitution and rights fully adhered to and represented, we would plot a course for thousands of years of happiness, prosperity and liberty.
 
Maney continues ?œThis is the unspoken flip side of Musk?™s SpaceX and Bezos?™s Blue Origin. The space travel companies say they are creating a way for the human species to endure by populating other planets. But the bottom line is that only the wealthy will have the means to move to Mars. column4: Dueling Protests in McKinney Nearly Erupt in Violence ??but News Cameras Captured a Moment That Should Be Front Page News | Video
column5:
Two groups of demonstrators, one supporting and the other protesting the police, faced off on Friday night in McKinney, Texas ??and violence nearly erupted. One group waved ?œblack lives matter??signs while the other owned the slogan ?œback the blue.??
While local news reports mostly focused on the conflict, there
column6:
Two groups of demonstrators, one supporting and the other protesting the police, faced off on Friday night in McKinney, Texas ??and violence nearly erupted. One group waved ?œblack lives matter??signs while the other owned the slogan ?œback the blue.??
While local news reports mostly focused on the conflict, there was one positive moment that drastically stood out.
As anger brewed among the dueling protests, a black man protesting police brutality and a white man supporting the police unexpectedly came together to discuss their differences in a civil manner. The two men held hands, hugged and prayed together, KDFW-TV reported.
?œThey want to make it a black and white thing, it?™s not a black and white thing,??Lashadion Anthony said. ?œIt?™s a community versus the police that are abusing their power. We?™re not saying that all police are racists and all police are bad, but there are certain police that are abusing their power.??

The other man, identified as Scott Harmaring by KDFW-TV, said the moment made it clear to him that opposing sides can ?œwork together.???œIt means there?™s a chance that we can fix some of the problems in our society today if we?™d all just learn to do what we just did and work together and pray together, there?™s a chance?¦the policeman that created the problem is gone, but that doesn?™t make our whole police department racist,??he added.

column4: At What Point Do You Obama Loyalists Begin Asking 'Why'? - Lloyd Marcus

BARBIE has been given her most surprising makeover yet ??and we don?™t just mean a curvier body or different skin tone.

Following the creation of the new curvier Barbie, we give you ?˜Hijarbie??

Complete with a tiny hijab on her plastic head, the miniature fashionista could not be further away from the blonde doll that has brandished the bedrooms of millions of youngsters for almost 60 years.

The ?˜Hijarbie??was created by 24-year-old Haneefah Adam, from Nigeria, who wanted to create a doll that dressed the way she did.

Her creation came just days after Mattel introduced a more realistic range of Barbie dolls in the biggest shake-up in the 57 year history of the model.

The new line includes four body types ??the original rail-thin Barbie, a taller Barbie, one with more curves and a petite version.

In addition there are seven skin tones, 22 eye colours and a number of hair styles.

column4: Editorial: I am a Black Conservative And Every American Needs To Read This
column5: If you read just one article today, make it this one. WWN Guest Writer Melvin Edwards tells us why he’s a black conservative, why every Black American should at least consider his thoughts, and how the Conservative Movement can make inroads in the Black community. In the light of the recent Charleston shooting and the rhetoric being spouted on all sides, I think this is especially pertinent today. Enjoy!
column6:
// 

Melvin Edwards
Being black and Republican is rare, but it?™s not unheard of and I don?™t feel lonely because of those confluent facts alone. The reality for me is that being black and Republican while living in Maryland has been a greater challenge. The politics here are the opposite of Texas??and I can tell you from experience that there?™s no one as intolerant as a liberal who is comfortably in the majority. This state is like a huge college campus with its ?œtenured??elected officials and lack of accountability whose bad ideas lead to predictable outcomes. For my first piece of evidence, I present to you: Baltimore ??a black-majority city that hasn?™t elected a Republican in almost 50 years.


Democrats and liberals in the age of Obama say they value independence and free speech, but that seems to be limited to agreeing with philosophies and ideals that reflect their own views. Try being against trending stances and see if your positions are treated as reasonable alternatives.

Being a black Republican in 2015 can carry ridicule, though normally not physical risk. But who wants to be ridiculed? On the other hand, it can also be a demeaning proposition when proximity alone allows people to collect their racial bona fides by accepting a racial minority as one of their own (i.e. ?œSome of my best friends are?¦â€?, then flaunting it as some kind of an accomplishment.

Black Republicanism is countercultural and individualist. However, individualism is the enemy of collectivism and political correctness.

Alan Keyes, Herman Cain, and Dr. Ben Carson are not equal candidates in the same way that Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio aren?™t, in the same way that Jeb Bush and Scott Walker aren?™t. But lumping together racial likenesses is easier than treating people as individuals when they self-identify as Republicans and you think the ideals espoused by the GOP make your opponent your enemy. And what better way to marginalize your opponent than through ridicule.

The best part about being a black Republican is the assumption that you?™re a Democrat, which allows plenty of fly-on-the-wall opportunities to Democrat conversations. If they don?™t adhere to the adage about assuming making asses, I am not compelled to protect them from them showing theirs.

CONTINUED BELOW AD

 // 
I recently learned that my paternal grandfather, who died 20 years before I was born, had been drafted into World War I. No solders ever had less to gain from war that black soldiers during WWI. In the Civil War, there was self-preservation and emancipation on the line. In WWII, there was the beginning of the Civil Rights Era and dignity. In World War I, black solders bravely fought internationally for a country that didn?™t recognize their rights back home. Yet, many remained patriotic Americans and many of their descendants are today.

Ignorance of history funnels black voters to Democrat straight-party voting and they would be stunned that until the mid-1960s, most black voters were on the other side of the aisle. Martin Luther King and Jackie Robinson were Republicans. I learned what I know from my parents ??who were both black ??but I have no idea what their political leanings were. They didn?™t talk about them because they couldn?™t talk about them. In the time period that provided their context, black people voting was a radical act in the Jim Crow South, so they voted and kept quiet. Jim Crow laws were Democrat ideas and enforced by members of that party, which is not to say that all Democrats thought that way.

As for me, I vote and also keep quiet. I?™m politically engaged and have even been politically employed, but when I?™m at work now, I never talk politics. In fact, some people who have known me for a decade or more have no idea what my political leanings are unless they ask. Most of them assume I?™m a Democrat, so they feel no need to ask.

Most people like labels because it puts things in easy-to-understand terms for them and simple terms are even better for them. I hate labels because they can represent intellectual laziness and covert racism.

 
In this age of Obama, we are closer to being a color-blind society, but further away from accepting differences. From my vantage point, we are not in a good place.
 //

column5:
black lives matter, *** , white lives, well, not so very much at all ....

on december 6, 2014 in the state of mississippi jessica chambers was doused in gasoline, and burned alive.   in the last several days a host of blacks have been arrested and charged with various matters unrelated to chambers's death, by way of information gathered during investigation of the murder.  the various arrests deal with drug and gun charges, and related topics under the general heading of thuggery.

you haven't read about it in the national news, nor have you seen it in the national television broadcasts, such as cover this sort of thing.

jessica chambers was 19 years old, a white female, at the date of her death.   those arrested are members of black gangs.   all of them.   jessica chambers associated with them prior to her death, not very intelligent choices of associates. none of them.

that does not begin to describe the bizarre nature of the events.  suffice it to say that persons associated with chambers called for the rape and death of white women.  by burning.--

"one week before, and on just the day before jessica chambers was carjacked and burned to death, certain blacks among her intimate circle and acquaintance were involved in facebook exchanges wherein calls for the rape and burnings of white women and children, especially the families of white police officer, were posted.  

"although not a police officer himself, jessica chambers??father is an employee of the panola county sheriff?™s department, in the vehicle maintenance section.

"[the writer posted] the comment, ?œsomebody need to rape all his kids in front of him then sit(sic) the house on fire an watch them burn??i bet he was a white man SAD??
the writer, self identified as "SAD" is sandy rudd, sister of brian rudd who was jessica chambers's one-time boy friend.   the post above at "clash daily" details other facts and cirstances associated with jessica chambers's murder, the most damning being that various persons associated with the rudds are seen talking to jessica chambers at a convenience store where she bought gas, and where one of the persons was seen carrying a gas can.  ibid.

go to the link, and read this horrible mess.

the point of this post is that the mainstream media has not made anything of this story in the year since the murder, and in the several days after the arrests of the black persons involved, on other charges, became public.

barak obama has not said that if he had had a white daughter she would have been just like jessica chambers.   jesse jackson has not rushed to mississippi to champion the cause of the dead white girl, nor has he condemned the murderous proclivities of the black gang members who are more than just likely responsible for her death.   nor, has al sharpton stepped forward to castigate black murderers of white women.

you read.

you make up your own mind.

column4: Timeline Photos
column5:
Read my novel, Men Cry In The Dark: Chapter 4, Around The Way Girl

These were the fond memories and lessons Angela took to the grave site with her every day for a week after the funeral. She would stand over her dear mother?™s grave and read letters aloud to express how much she missed her. Each message was filled with deep emotion and heartache. It was Angela?™s way of dealing with the anxiety and pain of losing her number one role model and her best friend. On the last night before she was preparing to leave for Atlanta, Angela locked herself in her mother?™s bedroom and prayed to God for guidance. Bright and early the following morning she wrote her final letter and then went to the grave site to deliver it to her mother.

Dear Mama,

I know you?™re tired of listening to all these sad letters. I?™ve been out here every day in the cold and rain just to read to you and have you all to myself. If I know you, you?™re probably lookÂ­ing down from heaven thinking, ?œThat child has lost her mind.??But the fact is that I miss you, Mama. I miss you so much that sometimes I don?™t think I?™m going to be able to make it. Every day I wake up hoping that all of this is just some kind of horrible dream, and that you?™re going to come into my room and tell me to get my lazy behind out of bed so we can go shopping. For a brief moment I?™m happy, and everything is the way it used to be. But after I get up and go into your empty bedroom, reality sets in; my whole world comes tumbling down around me. When that happens, nothing matters to me: not school, not my career, not even food. Look at me, I?™ve lost nearly fifteen pounds in the last two weeks; and I?™m as thin as a rail. I guess I can finally be a supermodel after all.

I?™m making fun because I woke up this morning with God?™s comforting arms wrapped around me. He told me everything was going to be all right and that it was time for me to get on with my life. That?™s when I sprang out of bed and took inventory of myself. I realized that I am the daughter of Ms. Faye Williams, a strong black woman who went through hell and high water to give her children a chance to make something of themselves in this cold world. I had to check myself, Mama, because you had to endure trials and tribulations ten times worse than death, and you made it. I was first embarrassed and then ashamed of myself for not being stronger for you and for Andre. But I want you to know that I?™m okay now, and with God?™s help I?™m ready to move forward with my life and honor your name. My only wish is that I will grow up to be half the woman that you were. I love you, Mama.

Rest in peace.
Your loving daughter,
Angela

column5:
Excerpt...  Ben Carson just played the race card in a most spectacular way. It came in the form of a solicitation e-mail to my Washington Post inbox Saturday morning. The subject line read ?œI will not be silenced,??and the missive was a screed against the press that he says is ?œrecklessly abusing this privilege??of being protected by the Constitution with its ?œrelentless attack[s]??against him. And then the famed neurosurgeon running a close second to Donald Trump in the quest for the Republican presidential nomination made this stunning claim:

As a black Republican, I know I don?™t fit the traditional mold, and I?™m a threat to the liberal order. Because of the color of my skin, I?™m supposed to think a certain way. Sorry, but that?™s racism??.

I refuse to act like a politician and say whatever I need to say to get elected. I will speak the truth regardless of what the media and the PC police say is ?œcontroversial.??It?™s time for honesty...

column4: Slave-like conditions found on farms supplying big supermarkets

Conclusive evidence of extreme labour exploitation, slave-like conditions and black market labour gangs has been found on farms and in factories supplying Australia's biggest supermarkets and fast food chains.

A Four Corners investigation has revealed the food being picked, packed and processed by exploited workers is being sold to consumers nationwide. 

The supermarkets involved include Woolworths, Coles, Aldi, IGA and Costco.

I told myself yesterday that I wasn?™t going to write another story about the ridiculous phony act that Rachel Dolezal is putting on.
And then I saw Alicia?™s story about liberal nut job Michael Eric Dyson saying that more black people identify with Rachel Dolezal than Justice Clarence Thomas.
After listening to Dyson?™s nonsense I didn?™t think this story could produce anything more ridiculous.
Boy, was I wrong.
Apparently, 71% of MSNBC viewers said it?™s perfectly fine for Rachel Dolezal to identify as a black transracial woman:
There?™s weapons-grade stupid walking around in America today, folks.
These liberal idiots, from the dummies who watch and respond to MSNBC polls to boobs likes Michael Eric Dyson, are only giving Dolezal a pass because she?™s a liberal.
The NAACP is the oldest and most useless civil rights organization in America. And Dolezal believed she had to dress up like a black Barbie doll to be the head of her local chapter.
Would these liberal loons give the same pass to a black person (not named Michael Jackson) who identified as white?
Hell no, they wouldn?™t.

Source
The Black Intellectual Tradition and the Myth of Objectivity
column5: "The idea of objectivity, he noted, is inherently flawed. It is a means of reinforcing racist agendas. Lowery explained that an unattainable standard of objectivity is routinely applied to reporters and journalists of color, especially those who write about race and racism. On the other hand, their white counterparts are assumed to be unbiased?“to have some sort of natural penchant for impartiality. That is why the first reports about police shootings of black people?”those that shape public impressions of their lives and deaths?”almost always come from police departments. When whiteness becomes the standard of objectivity, Baltimore County Police gets to kill Korryn Gaines and then write her obituary." Thanks Arlene DÃ¡vila for link.

AN UPDATE FOR DISH CUSTOMERS

As you may already know, KING 5 has been negotiating with DISH to keep our station in its lineup.

Our original deadline was September 30 but we extended that deadline by eight days, giving DISH more time to reach a deal.

Now, we are approaching the new deadline of October 9 at 4 pm and, unfortunately, DISH has not yet agreed to reach a fair, market-based agreement with us.

KING 5 is dedicated to providing all of our viewers the very best news, weather, sports and entertainment programming in our area, and being a part of this community. We are proud of the fact that we have NEVER had a situation where a major distributor stopped carrying our station.

But unless DISH changes course, you could lose some of your favorite programming and your local KING 5 news, weather and sports.

We are as disappointed as you are about this situation. After all, the deal being discussed with DISH is fundamentally similar to the deals we just reached with cable and satellite companies all across the country. And, frankly, we are concerned given DISH?™s recent pattern of taking stations away from its customers. As you may know, just this past August DISH blacked out broadcast networks in multiple markets across the country, impacting millions of families like yours.
 
You can still help us resolve this matter. If you contact DISH and let them know you want KING 5 on air, it may help us reach a deal. Also, you should know you have choices. KING 5 has agreements with every other provider in our area, and we are always available free over-the-air.

Visit www.king5.com/DISH to learn more.

column4: Timeline Photos
column5:
Today President Obama made a major address on firearm violence and gun control.  "I know we won?™t all agree on this issue. But it?™s time to be honest. Fewer gun safety laws don?™t mean more freedom, they mean more fallen officers. They mean more grieving families, and more Americans terrified that they or their loved ones could be next," he said.  But is that an "honest" assessment?  I decided to look into which variables are associated with firearm homicides, and which aren't.

FIREARM OWNERSHIP RATE: Coefficient = -1.17, Correlation = -0.10, R Squared = 0.01, p>|t| = 0.48.
As I said last week, firearm ownership is not correlated to firearm homicides.  What most gun control advocates don't understand is that gun ownership is not a reason people commit crimes.  If it was, then the states with the most guns would also have the highest homicide rates.  No, people commit murder for other reasons, and if you want to stop homicides, you have to address the motive, not the method.

POPULATION DENSITY: Coefficient = 0.0009, Correlation = -0.15, R Squared = 0.02, p>|t| = 0.29.
Several people have surmised that population density is related to firearm murders.  Although the data shows that it's not, population density isn't really the best measure to apply to states.  It would be better used at the county level, but I don't have that data.  Second, population density probably isn't the cause of homicides as much as it's related to where most homicides occur.  It doesn't help us discover why the murders occur, unless you buy into an argument that living in close proximity to other people makes you violent.

POVERTY RATE: Coefficient = 0.22, Correlation = 0.56, R Squared = 0.32, p>|t| = 0.00002 (very high significance).
Poverty is the first variable to show a correlation to firearm murder rates.  But it would be inaccurate to say poverty causes homicides.  Instead, it seems to be a trait often shared by those who commit murders.  With an R squared of 0.32, it seems poverty explains some, but not most, of the variations in firearm murder rates.

PERCENT OF THE POPULATION THAT IS AFRICAN-AMERICAN: Coefficient = 12.19, Correlation = 0.77, R Squared = 0.60, p>|t| = 0.00000000005 (very high significance).
This variable is the most highly correlated of all that I tested.  With an R squared of 0.60, it explains most of the variation in state firearm murder rates.  But before you go screaming racism, I'm not contending that skin color causes murders.  Remember, correlation does not necessarily indicate causation.  Instead, I believe this data merely confirms that many African-American communities are plagued with a culture of violence that makes firearm homicides much more frequent.  And although most people don't acknowledge this elephant in the room, the statistics support the conclusion.

Although they only make up 12.9% of the population, blacks commit 52.6% of murders according to the FBI.  And 83% of their victims are also black.  So it makes sense that states with higher black populations also have higher rates of murder, which is what the data shows.

If this is indeed a causal relationship, then gun control advocates are focused on the wrong "solution".  Instead, addressing the culture of violence in African-American communities should be the focal point of efforts to reduce firearm homicides.

SOURCES: https://www.fbi.gov/about-us/cjis/ucr/crime-in-the-u.s/2010/crime-in-the-u.s.-2010/tables/10tbl20.xls
http://usliberals.about.com/od/Election2012Factors/a/Gun-Owners-As-Percentage-Of-Each-States-Population.htm
https://www.fbi.gov/about-us/cjis/ucr/crime-in-the-u.s/2014/crime-in-the-u.s.-2014/tables/expanded-homicide-data/expanded_homicide_data_table_6_murder_race_and_sex_of_vicitm_by_race_and_sex_of_offender_2014.xls
https://www.fbi.gov/about-us/cjis/ucr/crime-in-the-u.s/2014/crime-in-the-u.s.-2014/tables/expanded-homicide-data/expanded_homicide_data_table_3_murder_offenders_by_age_sex_and_race_2014.xls

But two years ago, the Supreme Court ripped out some of the Act's most important provisions ??and states all across the country have passed voter ID laws, registration hurdles, and other shameful tactics that restrict people?™s right to vote and push our country in the wrong direction.
